results.title: Beautiful lies: a film about Peter Carey
results.creator_credit: Don Featherstone, Australian Film Commission and Australia Council
results.brief_description: Peter Carey is one of Australia’s most talented writers. All four of his published works have won major literary awards. This film, takes a journey through his life and work and looks at the way he transforms his native country into a bizarre land of nightmares and surreal comedy. Throughout the film, an interview with Peter Carey is interwoven with lavish dramatisation. An intriguing and illuminating film about a remarkable writer.
results.title_for_label: Beautiful lies: a film about Peter Carey
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Featherstone, Australian Film Commission and Australia Council

results.title: Peter Porter
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
From his book-crammed London flat, Peter Porter introduces a variety of his best-known poems and presents his accessible and humane intelligence.

results.title: David Malouf: an imaginary life
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
Poet and novelist David Malouf was filmed in Tuscany, Italy, during the coldest winter there for 50 years, and in Sydney during a steamy summer. To write, he says, you must turn your back on even the most beautiful landscape. Malouf talks about the influences on his work and how he gets into the writing process.

results.title: Les Murray
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
Filmed at his home, a poetry reading and on his family’s farm in Northern NSW, Les Murray shares his love for poetry in this colourful and engaging portrait.

results.title: Roland Robinson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
A poet with a strong attachment to the Australian landscape, Roland Robinson has a deep interest in Aboriginal lore, and performs his poetry with a memorable verve.

results.title: Randolph Stow
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
Filmed on location in the landscapes of Suffolk and East Angliam, his present home, Randolf Stow talks of his life and shares examples of his poetry and prose.

results.title: Not just a number
results.creator_credit: Shalagh McCarthy, Rob Richardson and Amalgamated Metal Workers and Shipwrights Union
results.brief_description: A three part documentary examining industrial democracy in Australia: 1) Job redesign. Demonstrates how employees exercise decision-making, responsibility and initiative in their private lives and contracts with the usual workplace situation where most decisions are made by management. 2) Better managers. Shows a factory owned and operated by the workers providing a working example of successful worker participation and industrial democracy. 3) Is it a con? Examines unsuccessful industrial democracy initiatives where only the semblance of power has been transferred to the workers.

results.title: Children with special abilities
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: This film explores curriculum strategies and organisational approaches which can meet the needs of children with special abilities. The school Principal, several teachers, a consultant and various children are interviewed. Two children, Emma (aged seven) and Campbell (aged ten), are featured to highlight the characteristics and learning needs of such children. Suitable for Tertiary/Teacher education.

results.title: Tommy
results.brief_description: Using interviews with and about Tommy Woodcock, this program tells the story of one of Australia’s most renowned racehorse trainers. In particular it concentrates on his work with Phar Lap and Reckless.
